s.text: Animals build nests, burrows, and protective cases and so alter the environment they experience in a way that may select for further adaptations.

Though it is rare for the authors to offer new analysis and insight, their sideways look at many issues from the niche-construction viewpoint often offers interesting new angles on old problems, and suggests new avenues of enquiry that may be the book's greatest legacy.
For example, some of the clearest examples of niche construction occur in plant succession where, as F.E.
Interestingly, the strict Clementsian theory of facilitation, niche construction avant la lettre , has given way to a more pluralistic theory of succession.
